Representation at Meetings
It has come to the attention of various members of the P.R. Committee
that there is a lackof NAEB representation at many meetings of learned
groups. Since the membership of the Committee encompasses most of the
areas of the United States, the chairman of the committee has offered
to provide as far as possible such representation from the membership
of the committee, in each case selecting a member sufficiently near the
place of meeting to free the NAEB of all expense.

Lapel Pin Proposal
A proposal has been made that NAEB adopt an official lapel pin.
Several designs have: been made and circulated to Committee members.
As of now, those of the Committee who have commented are perfectly
divided on the idea. Those favoring the idea of a pin have each
favored a different design; one member does not like the idea of a
pin. On this point the Committee earnestly requests the comments of
its constituents.
Up-Grading the P.R. Manual
During the course of the year your Chairman solicited and received
from various members of the Committee numerous suggestions and ideas that
might be incorporated into future editions of the Manual.
P.R, Article
An authoritative illustrated article entitled "Personalized Public
Relations was prepared by Committee Member Marion Corwell for publication
in the NAEB magazine.
